intro: Astronia acuminatissima var. palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan astronia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with smooth margins and a woody stem. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and montane forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
